intro: Euphrasia officinalis f. subeglandulosa, commonly known as the glandular eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are often glandular, giving it a distinct texture and appearance. It has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
